Posts.Content: Hi Sorry to bother you souls out there but I am looking for advice... I love swimming and playing in the water, I have been told as my one breast is a Double D none of the prosthetics will work very well in the water, they will slip and fall out of place , get to heavy etc... Basically I've been left feeling that to continue with my love of water that I should consider a reconstruction otherwise I won't be able to indulge my playful passion of water...  Anyone have any thoughts ? Thank you...
Posts.Title: Swimming after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Pepys I have a very handy friend who can sew well (unlike me)... So will try this option first as totally agree, no point in wasting cash when its in short supply Jane xx
Posts.Title: Swimming after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Lynne I'll definitely be trying out these options... Sounds very promising.    Jane
Posts.Title: Swimming after Mastectomy

Posts.Content: Thanks Sazzieann Wishing you well for your mastectomy on the 29th.. Are you nervous, apprehensive etc ? Best wishes and kind regards       Jane  xx
